week3.practice1_html:

week3.practice2_html:
What it is

The Popeye Protocol helps you rebuild your iron stores through simple, food-based routines so your scalp and follicles get the oxygen and nutrients they need to stay strong and grow new strands.

Jet, youâ€™re in your stabilization phaseâ€”your shedding has eased and those baby hairs you noticed months ago are proof your follicles are trying to reâ€‘enter growth. But low iron can quietly hold them back, especially after years of hormonal shifts and stress that deplete reserves. This is your â€œbig dominoâ€: with steady iron nourishment, those fragile new hairs can thicken and stay put through the months ahead toward regrowth.

  1. Start your day with iron + C: Add 1 ironâ€‘rich food at breakfastâ€”like eggs with spinach, oatmeal with pumpkin seeds, or a small beef pattyâ€”and pair it with fruit rich in vitaminâ€¯C (kiwi, berries, or orange slices) to boost absorption.
  2. Lunch or dinner anchor: Include a palmâ€‘sized portion of protein (lean meat, lentils, tofu, or tempeh) and dark greens at least once daily; drizzle with olive oil or lemon to aid absorption.
  3. Separate inhibitors: Keep coffee, tea, or calcium supplements at least an hour away from highâ€‘iron meals so they donâ€™t block uptake.

week3.practice3_html:

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Include a serving of fatty fish (salmon, sardines, mackerel) twice a week, or choose algaeâ€‘based capsules if you prefer plant options.
  2. Drizzle a teaspoon of flaxseed or chia oil on oatmeal, yogurt, or roasted vegetables; avoid heating these oils.

  5. Stay steady for three weeks; your body needs consistent intake to rebuild membranes around each follicle.
